a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Payloads and rocket bodies in space, by orbit
Debris from launches or collisions is not counted. Objects are subtracted from the time series after they have
Data source: United States Space Force (2024)
Note: Low Earth orbit is defined here by a closest approach to Earth below 2,000 kilometers; medium Earth orbit between 2,000 and 35,586
kilometers; geostationary orbit between 35,586 and 35,986 kilometers; high Earth orbit above 35,986 kilometers.
